x.description: The x-coordinates at which to evaluate the interpolated values.

xp.description: The x-coordinates of the data points, must be increasing if argument period is not specified. Otherwise, xp is internally sorted after normalizing the periodic boundaries with xp = xp % period.

fp.description: The y-coordinates of the data points, same length as xp.

left.type: optional float or complex corresponding to fp
left.description: Value to return for x < xp[0], default is fp[0].

right.type: optional float or complex corresponding to fp
right.description: Value to return for x > xp[-1], default is fp[-1].

period.description: A period for the x-coordinates. This parameter allows the proper interpolation of angular x-coordinates. Parameters left and right are ignored if period is specified.  New in version 1.10.0.

y.type: float or complex (corresponding to fp) or ndarray
y.description: The interpolated values, same shape as x.
